trans-unit.source: Displays an input box to ask the user to enter a string.

seg-source.mrk: Displays an input box to ask the user to enter a string.

target.mrk: Displays an input box to ask the user to enter a string.

trans-unit.source: Parameters
The title of the input box.

seg-source.mrk: The title of the input box.

target.mrk: The title of the input box.

trans-unit.source: A message to the user indicating what kind of input is expected.

seg-source.mrk: A message to the user indicating what kind of input is expected.

target.mrk: A message to the user indicating what kind of input is expected.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The value that the input box starts with.

seg-source.mrk: The value that the input box starts with.

target.mrk: The value that the input box starts with.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The character to replace all typed characters with in the display. If you want the actual typed character to appear, define with an empty string ("") (default) or a space for the first character. If you provide a multi-character string, only the first character is used for character masking. There are special meanings for the second and subsequent characters. See Remarks.

seg-source.mrk: The character to replace all typed characters with in the display.
If you want the actual typed character to appear, define with an empty string ("") (default) or a space for the first character.
If you provide a multi-character string, only the first character is used for character masking.
There are special meanings for the second and subsequent characters.

target.mrk: The character to replace all typed characters with in the display.
If you want the actual typed character to appear, define with an empty string ("") (default) or a space for the first character.
If you provide a multi-character string, only the first character is used for character masking.
There are special meanings for the second and subsequent characters.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The width of the window.
[optional] The height of the window.
[optional] The left side of the input box. By default, the box is centered.

seg-source.mrk: The left side of the input box.
By default, the box is centered.

target.mrk: The left side of the input box.
By default, the box is centered.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The top of the input box. By default, the box is centered.

seg-source.mrk: The top of the input box.
By default, the box is centered.

target.mrk: The top of the input box.
By default, the box is centered.

trans-unit.source: [optional] How many seconds to wait before automatically canceling the InputBox().

seg-source.mrk: How many seconds to wait before automatically canceling the InputBox().

target.mrk: How many seconds to wait before automatically canceling the InputBox().

trans-unit.source: [optional] The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

seg-source.mrk: The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

target.mrk: The window handle to use as the parent for this dialog.

trans-unit.source: Return Value
the string that was entered.
"" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: "" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: "" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: @error:
1 = The Cancel button was pushed.
2 = The Timeout time was reached.
3 = The InputBox failed to open. This is usually caused by bad arguments.

seg-source.mrk: This is usually caused by bad arguments.

target.mrk: This is usually caused by bad arguments.

trans-unit.source: 4 = The InputBox cannot be displayed on any monitor.

seg-source.mrk: 4 = The InputBox cannot be displayed on any monitor.

target.mrk: 4 = The InputBox cannot be displayed on any monitor.

trans-unit.source: 5 = Invalid parameters width without height or left without top.

seg-source.mrk: 5 = Invalid parameters width without height or left without top.

target.mrk: 5 = Invalid parameters width without height or left without top.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
The InputBox() is user-resizable, but has a minimum size of approximately 190 x 115 pixels. Default size is approximately 250 x 190 pixels.

seg-source.mrk: The InputBox() is user-resizable, but has a minimum size of approximately 190 x 115 pixels.
Default size is approximately 250 x 190 pixels.

target.mrk: The InputBox() is user-resizable, but has a minimum size of approximately 190 x 115 pixels.
Default size is approximately 250 x 190 pixels.

trans-unit.source: The string returned will not exceed 254 characters and if input contains carriage returns or linefeeds, the result will be truncated at the first occurrence of those characters.

seg-source.mrk: The string returned will not exceed 254 characters and if input contains carriage returns or linefeeds, the result will be truncated at the first occurrence of those characters.

target.mrk: The string returned will not exceed 254 characters and if input contains carriage returns or linefeeds, the result will be truncated at the first occurrence of those characters.

trans-unit.source: The second and subsequent characters of the password field can be used to restrict input. Use a space to fill the first character to still see the characters typed. Putting an M after the first character indicates that input is Mandatory; i.e. you must enter something. Nothing will happen if you press the Ok button when there is nothing in the InputBox(). It will not close and return the string.

seg-source.mrk: The second and subsequent characters of the password field can be used to restrict input.
Use a space to fill the first character to still see the characters typed.
Putting an M after the first character indicates that input is Mandatory; i.e. you must enter something.
Nothing will happen if you press the Ok button when there is nothing in the InputBox().
It will not close and return the string.

target.mrk: The second and subsequent characters of the password field can be used to restrict input.
Use a space to fill the first character to still see the characters typed.
Putting an M after the first character indicates that input is Mandatory; i.e. you must enter something.
Nothing will happen if you press the Ok button when there is nothing in the InputBox().
It will not close and return the string.

trans-unit.source: If your script is going to use an inputbox you must include the pragma directive "#pragma compile(inputboxres, true)"

seg-source.mrk: If your script is going to use an inputbox you must include the pragma directive "#pragma compile(inputboxres, true)"

target.mrk: If your script is going to use an inputbox you must include the pragma directive "#pragma compile(inputboxres, true)"

trans-unit.source: You can also specify the maximum length at the end of the password field. Just enter a number as the last character(s) to specify the length of the string.

seg-source.mrk: You can also specify the maximum length at the end of the password field.
Just enter a number as the last character(s) to specify the length of the string.

target.mrk: You can also specify the maximum length at the end of the password field.
Just enter a number as the last character(s) to specify the length of the string.

Example
Places the input box in the top left corner displaying the characters as they

target.mrk: Places the input box in the top left corner displaying the characters as they

trans-unit.source: are typed.
Question
Where were you born?
Planet Earth
Display the result.
Asks the user to enter a password. Don't forget to validate it!

seg-source.mrk: Asks the user to enter a password.

target.mrk: Asks the user to enter a password.

trans-unit.source: Security Check
Enter your password.
Display the result.
Asks the user to enter a 1 or 2 character response. The M in the password

seg-source.mrk: Asks the user to enter a 1 or 2 character response.

target.mrk: Asks the user to enter a 1 or 2 character response.

trans-unit.source: field indicates that empty string is not accepted and the 2 indicates that the

seg-source.mrk: field indicates that empty string is not accepted and the 2 indicates that the

target.mrk: field indicates that empty string is not accepted and the 2 indicates that the

trans-unit.source: responce will be at most 2 characters long.

seg-source.mrk: responce will be at most 2 characters long.

target.mrk: responce will be at most 2 characters long.

trans-unit.source: Testing
Enter the 1 or 2 character code.
M2
Display the result.
